review: You get what you pay for- As far a streaming devices go, this one is very basic, but what can you expect for $39? It is small, easy to set up and provides very nice HD images of the programs it streams- HOWEVER, it is mostly to sell you Amazon content, and does NOT incorprate a full web browser. It will NOT convert you TV into a "smart TV". You get the standard  built-in apps (Amazon, Netflix, Hulu, YouTube, etc) but you cannot go outside of Amazon's  programmed plan for this. That said, the remote is small (about half the size of a smart phone), and the set- up is fairly simple, although I had to call Comcast to re-configure my router output to match what the Fire Stick would pick up. All in all, I say wait for the next generation, this one is too limited in its scope~

review: Overall, I really like my firestick. I cannot imagine buying a smart TV for the price they are going for, so this is a great alternative. I keep mine plugged in a HDMI port in my TV so it is always ready when I want to use it. I like that I can switch between Youtube, movies and TV shows quickly and easily. The remote is simple, easy to use and has a long range. I can play and pause from anywhere in my 1500 sq. ft single level house. The screensaver feature with the pretty images are a nice touch. There is a wide selection of apps which is nice, but the game selection leaves a little to be desired. My only issue so far is connectivity issues. It seems to only happen with TV shows and certain apps. Movies have always played well for me. I don't believe it's an issue with my Wifi, but it could be. I am a little confused by the power supply. I am not sure if it holds a charge or if I am supposed to keep it plugged in all the time. I will have to experimet more, as the power cord is fairly short so I can imagine circumstances where it would not reach an outlet while plugged into a TV.
